Most likely a regression from https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/3fbc5f9860c28d026fcd2864cf955e8899e0d589

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run `nvim --clean`
2. Source the following file:
```vim
new
autocmd Syntax * ++once bwipe!
setlocal syntax=vim
```
3. ASAN reports a heap-use-after-free

### Expected behavior

No heap-use-after-free

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.12.0-dev-2049+gdde914f926

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No, Vim 9.1.2086

### Operating system/version

Arch Linux

### Terminal name/version

kitty 0.45.0

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-kitty

### Installation

build from repo

comment_data.body:
I think that's OK:
- If `do_syntax_autocmd()` is called inside `ex_listdo()` (which is the only place where `BF_SYN_SET` is used), the `apply_autocmds()` is supposed to be no-op, as `ex_listdo()` blocks `Syntax` autocommands.
- If `do_syntax_autocmd()` is called outside `ex_listdo()`, changes to `BF_SYN_SET` won't affect any `ex_listdo()` calls, as `ex_listdo()` resets `BF_SYN_SET` flags.
Actually, I think it doesn't need to be moved outside the function. `buf` should be valid just before calling `apply_autocmds()`.

Thx for verifying. I thought that it would make more sense if the flag was set in `did_set_option()` than in `do_syntax_autocmd()` since setting the flag doesn't seem to have anything to do with the processing of autocommands? But since it makes no practical difference I can put it inside `do_syntax_autocmd()` if u prefer.

> setting the flag doesn't seem to have anything to do with the processing of autocommands

It does. Look at what `ex_listdo()` uses it for. It's used for postponing the execution of `Syntax` autocommands when setting 'syntax' in `ex_listdo()`.
Ah, I see what you mean. Will open a pr. Do you think a test for this is needed?

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/autocmd/autocmd_spec.lua b/test/functional/autocmd/autocmd_spec.lua
index df00753a57..f68695bc83 100644
--- a/test/functional/autocmd/autocmd_spec.lua
+++ b/test/functional/autocmd/autocmd_spec.lua
@@ -716,6 +716,15 @@ describe('autocmd', function()
     ]]
   end)
 
+  it('no use-after-free when wiping buffer in Syntax autocommand', function()
+    exec([[
+      new
+      autocmd Syntax * ++once bwipe!
+      setlocal syntax=vim
+    ]])
+    assert_alive()
+  end)
+
   it('no use-after-free from win_enter autocommands in win_move_after', function()
     exec [[
       split foo
```

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

labels.description: wrong behavior that was introduced in a previous commit (please bisect)
labels.name: bug-regression

title: heap-use-after-free with :bwipe in Syntax autocmd
